A Republican donor did pay Fusion GPS to conduct opposition research on Trump during the primary but the firm never commissioned the dossier to British ex-spy Christopher Steele until the Clinton campaign and DNC began paying Fusion — months after the Republican donor had left the picture.
A CNN panel falsely blamed both Republicans and Democrats for financing a dossier on Donald Trump that was assembled by British former spy using Russian sources.

(RELATED: Democrats’ Russia Narrative Spiraling Out Of Control)

Here’s what Steele filed in London court earlier this year — Fusion hired his firm in *June*.

pic.twitter.com/NSwlcS0Jre — Chuck Ross (@ChuckRossDC) October 25, 2017

Fact-checkers have rated it “false” that Republicans paid for the dossier.

Swerdick claimed that who funded the dossier was relatively unimportant because, he said, “both sides had a hand in this.”

That is false.
Wolf Blitzer, host of CNN’s “The Situation Room,” falsely said that a Republican donor originally funded the dossier.
Despite the facts, both Blitzer and Swerdick falsely informed viewers that Republicans had paid for the dossier.
